official-title.#text: To prohibit brand name drug companies from compensating generic drug companies to delay the entry of a generic drug into the market, and for other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on the
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Protecting Consumer Access to Generic Drugs Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Unfair and deceptive acts and practices related to new drug applications

text.#text: It shall be unlawful for any person to directly or indirectly be a party to any agreement resolving or settling a patent infringement claim in which—
an ANDA filer receives anything of value; and

the ANDA filer agrees not to research, develop, manufacture, market, or sell, for any period of time, the drug that is to be manufactured under the ANDA involved and is the subject of the patent infringement claim.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Consumer Access to Generic Drugs Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: does not prohibit a resolution or settlement of a patent infringement claim in which the value received by the ANDA filer includes no more than—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Consumer Access to Generic Drugs Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: the right to market the drug that is to be manufactured under the ANDA involved and is the subject of the patent infringement claim, before the expiration of—
the patent that is the basis for the patent infringement claim; or
any other statutory exclusivity that would prevent the marketing of such drug; and
the waiver of a patent infringement claim for damages based on prior marketing of such drug.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be treated as an unfair and deceptive act or practice and an unfair method of competition in or affecting interstate commerce prohibited under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Consumer Access to Generic Drugs Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall enforce this Act in the same manner, by the same means, and with the same jurisdiction as though all applicable terms and provisions of the
were incorporated into and made a part of this Act.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Trade Commission Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Trade Commission Act/s:5

term.#tail: means anything that would constitute an agreement for purposes of

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Trade Commission Act/s:5

term.#tail: , in reference to a patent infringement claim, includes any agreement that is contingent upon, provides a contingent condition for, or is otherwise related to the resolution or settlement of the claim.
means an abbreviated new drug application for the approval of a new drug under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 505(j) of the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act/s:505/ss:j

term.#tail: means a party that has filed an ANDA with the

means infringement of any patent or of any filed patent application, extension, reissuance, renewal, division, continuation, continuation in part, reexamination, patent term restoration, patent of addition, or extension thereof.
means any allegation made to an ANDA filer, whether or not included in a complaint filed with a court of law, that its ANDA or drug to be manufactured under such ANDA may infringe any patent.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Protecting Consumer Access to Generic Drugs Act of 2013/s:2

text.#text: The Chief Executive Officer or the company official responsible for negotiating any agreement required to be filed under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , with respect to the agreement referenced in this certification: (1) represent the complete, final, and exclusive agreement between the parties; (2) include any ancillary agreements that are contingent upon, provide a contingent condition for, or are otherwise related to, the referenced agreement; and (3) include written descriptions of any oral agreements, representations, commitments, or promises between the parties that are responsive to
